content:
Here is a verbal portrait of a sculptor in the Tang Dynasty:

The sculptor was a skilled artist, renowned for his ability to create beautiful and intricate works of art in a variety of materials, including bronze, stone, and wood. He was known for his attention to detail and his ability to depict a wide range of subjects, including animals, figures, and mythical creatures.

The sculptor was a patient and dedicated artist, with a deep understanding and appreciation of the art of sculpture. He was always willing to spend hours, even days, perfecting a single work, striving for perfection in every detail.

Despite the demands of his craft, the sculptor was a humble and compassionate person, with a kind and generous spirit. He was always willing to share his knowledge and expertise with others, and his love of sculpture was a source of great joy and inspiration to those around him.

Overall, the sculptor was a truly accomplished and talented artist, one that would be remembered for centuries to come as a master of his craft. His works were admired for their beauty and craftsmanship, and they continue to be treasured to this day.
